lines.gurmukhi: jYsy mwq ipqw kyrI syvw srvn kInI isK ibrlo eI gur syvw ThrwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Maat Pitaa Kayree Sayvaa Saravan Keenee , Sikh Biralo Ee Gur Sayvaa Tthaharaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A rare disciple would stay and serve his Guru just as noble Sarvan served his blind parents so dedicatedly.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy lCmn rGupiq Bwie Bgq mY koit mDy kwhU gurBweI bin AwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Lachhaman Raghoupati Bhaai Bhagat Mai , Koti Madhay Kaahoo Gurbhaaee Bani Aavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Some rare devotee would serve his Guru with so much love and devotion with which Lachhman served his brother Ram.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy jl brn brn srbMg rMg ibrlo ibbykI swD sMgiq smwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Jal Baran Baran Sarabang Ranga , Biralo Bibaykee Saadh Sangati Samaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As water mixes with any colour to acquire the same hue; thus a rare Sikh contemplating and practising meditation merges into the holy gathering of Guru's devotees.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK sMiD imly bIs iekIs eIs pUrn kiRpw kY kwhU AlK lKwveI ]103]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Bees Ikees Eesa , Pooran Kripaa Kai Kaahoo Alakh Lakhaavaee ?103?

Shabad OS B.translation: On meeting the Guru and receiving the blessings of initiation from him, a Sikh surely reaches and realises God to become one with Him. Thus a True Guru showers his beneficence on a rare Sikh and lifts him to the divine level of supreme consciousness. (103
